explosives.rationale: Containing no chemical groups with explosive properties

flammable_gases.rationale: Classified as "solid" according to GHS definition

oxidizing_gases.rationale: Classified as "solid" according to GHS definition

gases_under_pressure.rationale: Classified as "solid" according to GHS definition

flammable_liquids.rationale: Classified as "solid" according to GHS definition

flammable_solids.rationale: Classification not possible due to lack of data, though classified as "flammable" by ICSC (2004)

self_reactive_substances.rationale: Containing no chemical groups with explosive or self-reactive properties

pyrophoric_liquids.rationale: Classified as "solid" according to GHS definition

pyrophoric_solids.rationale: Not pyrophoric when in contact with air at ordinary temperatures: the auto-ignition temperature is 570degC (ICSC, 2004)

self_heating_substances.rationale: Test methods applicable to liquid substances are not available (melting point: 131degC (ICSC, 2004), test temperature: 140degC)

substances_mixtures_emit_flammable_gas_i.hazard_name: Substances and mixtures which, in contact with water, emit flammable gases
substances_mixtures_emit_flammable_gas_i.rationale: Containing no metals or metalloids (B, Si, P, Ge, As, Se, Sn, Sb, Te, Bi, Po, At)

oxidizing_liquids.rationale: Classified as "solid" according to GHS definition

oxidizing_solids.rationale: Organic compounds containing oxygen (but not fluorine and chlorine), with the oxygen bound to carbon and hydrogen (but not to other elements)

corrosive_to_metals.rationale: Test methods applicable to solid substances are not available

acute_toxicity_oral.rationale: Based on the rat LD50 (oral route) value of 1,530mg/kg (MOE Risk Assessment vol. 2 (2003)).

acute_toxicity_dermal.rationale: Classification not possible because the rabbit LD50 (dermal route) values of >3,160mg/kg and >10,000mg/kg (IUCLID (2000)) are not definitive values.

acute_toxicity_inhalation_gas.rationale: Due to the fact that the substance is "solid" according to the GHS definition and inhalation of its gas is not expected.

acute_toxicity_inhalation_dust.rationale: Because the rat LC50 (inhalation) value of >0.21mg/L (34ppm when the conversion factor of 1ppm = 6.16mg/m3 (20degC) was applied) (MOE Risk Assessment vol. 2 (2003)) exceeded the saturated vapour concentration (0.03ppm) under a saturated vapour pressure of 0.0003hPa (20degC), the substance was considered as "dust exposure." However, classification is not possible since the LC50 of >0.21mg/L is not a fixed value.

skin_corrosion_irritation.rationale: Based on the description in the report on rabbit skin irritation tests (CERI Hazard Data 2000-54 (2001)): "The substance induced moderate irritation when applied to abraded skin."

serious_eye_damage_irritation.rationale: Based on the description in the report on rabbit eye irritation tests (CERI Hazard Data 2000-54 (2001)): "severely irritating to the eye." Although classified into Category 1-2A in the absence of data on reversibility, the substance should be placed in Category 1 from the viewpoint of safety.

respiratory_skin_sensitizer.hazard_statement: May cause allergy or asthma symptoms or breathing difficulties if inhaled
respiratory_skin_sensitizer.rationale: Due to the fact that the substance is reported as a "Respiratory Sensitizing Substance" by the ad hoc committee of the Japanese Society of Occupational Allergy (2004).

germ_cell_mutagenicity.hazard_statement: May cause an allergic skin reaction
germ_cell_mutagenicity.rationale: Based on the description in the report on Buehler tests and Intracutaneous tests on guinea pigs (CERI Hazard Data 2000-54 (2001)): "sensitization: positive." Also based on the overall conclusion made by CERI Hazard Data 2000-54 (2001): "The substance possesses a potential for sensitization for human skin."

carcinogenicity.rationale: Based on the absence of data on in vivo mutagenicity/genotoxicity tests and no positive data on mutagenicity tests in vitro (several indices).

toxic_to_reproduction.rationale: Due to the fact that the substance is classified as Category A4 by ACGIH (2001).

systemic_toxicity_single_exposure.hazard_statement: Suspected of damaging fertility or the unborn child
systemic_toxicity_single_exposure.rationale: Based on the evidence of adverse effects on sperm production, testes and epididymis, described in MOE Risk Assessment vol. 2 (2003) (though no data are available on maternal toxicity).

systemic_toxicity_repeat_exposure.hazard_name: Specific target organ toxicity - Single exposure
systemic_toxicity_repeat_exposure.hazard_statement: May cause respiratory irritation (respiratory tract irritation)
systemic_toxicity_repeat_exposure.rationale: Based on the human evidence: "burning sensation in the upper respiratory tract and coughing were noted immediately after accidental inhalation of high concentrations" (CERI Hazard Data 2000-54 (2001)).

aspiration_hazard.hazard_name: Specific target organ toxicity - Repeated exposure
aspiration_hazard.hazard_statement: Cause damage to organs through prolonged or repeated exposure (respiratory system)
aspiration_hazard.rationale: Based on the human evidence including "conjunctivitis, hemorrhagic rhinorrhea, nasal mucosal atrophy, coughing, bloody phlegm, bronchitis, pulmonary emphysema," "after the latency period of 16 years, 13 patients (11%) had chronic bronchitis and 21 (18%) had asthma," "the substance-induced asthma was observed" (CERI Hazard Data 2000-54 (2001)), "asthma occurred following exposure" (HSDB (2005)), "hemorrhagic rhinorrhea, nasal mucosal atrophy, hoarse voice, coughing, bloody phlegm, bronchitis and pulmonary emphysema" (ACGIH (7th, 2001)).

acute_aquatic_toxicity.rationale: It was classified into Category 3 from 72 hours ErC50=68mg/L of the algae (Selenastrum) (MOE Eco-Toxicity Tests of Chemicals, 2003).

chronic_aquatic_toxicity.rationale: Since there was rapidly degrading (the decomposition by BOD: 85.2% (Existing Chemical Safety Inspections Data)) and the bio-accumulation was low (log Kow=1.6 (PHYSPROP Database, 2005)), it was claasified into Not classified.
